segments.text: Let ’ s see if we can reach some sort of agreement over your curfew .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok , every one asks their parents let them stay out until 2 or 3 in the morning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I ’ m not everyone-else ’ s father . I think you need be in the house by ten o ’ clock .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s absurd . I know some junior high kids who can stay out later than that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ ll be worried if you stay out late .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok , how about midnight curfew . and I'll let you know where I am .
segments.speaker: S2
